column4: kenkku: I changed it to work with xscreensaver, and, in a fit of stupidity, deleted it manually when i uninstalled xscreensaver. :D
ah, so no bug there :) glad I could help

One more quick question if you don't mind? You happen to remember the package name for the extra screensavers? The ones commonly reccomended to install when switching to xscreensaver? Half of them crash my system.
would that be xscreensaver-gl-extra or xscreensaver-data-extra?
Possibly...though when i try to unsinstall those, synaptic tries to tell me it's going to uninstall ubuntu desktop. And that kinda worries me.
well, I have xscreensaver-data and xscreensaver-gl installed by default and I've never installed xscreensaver
Hrm, guess I get to forum search for that old guide I followed, and just like, do it backwards. Ok, thanks.
gnome-screensaver seems to recommend those packages
Well, I'm looking for the forum guide right now, but somewhere in it there's a package of non-default screensavers mentioned, and I installed those. Most of which lock my system up hardcore. :\
that would be those -extra packages
So, um, you're telling me that once I installed them, I can't uninstall them?
you should be able to uninstall them
Ok, then help me out, what is it going to remove when it removes 'ubuntu desktop'? Cuz when i try to remove those extra packages via synaptic, it tells me it needs to remove that as well.
could you paste the output of apt-get to pastebin.com for me?
http://pastebin.com/m5f37f344 There it is, but I think that's not likely to be what you're looking for.
the output you get when trying to uninstall the package, I meant. sorry
Aaahhh. I use Synaptic...can I post a screenshot?
when you click apply, what packages does it apply for removal?
I must appologise for wasting your time...I was trying to remove the wrong package...
yeah, that's what I suspected
it's no problem :)
Ok, thanks much. I'll be out of your hair now. Need to help a buddy of mine install ubuntu. :D
